page.title: 16Today/Yesterday(3/4)
page.content: An interview with Frank Collins. "As today, it was very difficult to find{work}when I left school in{1931 and if you got a job the{hours were {long and the pay low.}There were many more factories in{Smethwick}then, the main industries being{iron & steel, {lighthouse glass,scales}etc.{Canals were used more than now. The{M5 and M6 did not exist. A lot of{goods traffic was carried by{steam train.}Most people only used the train if they were lucky enough to go on holiday or the occasional cheap day trip. The {parks}were nicer, some had{bandstands where{concerts and pierrot shows}were held. That does not happen now. The main{shopping}areas were the High St and the Cape, both have since declined.{Bearwood}was and still is a major shopping area."
